intro: Xyphostylis lutea, commonly known as the yellow bulbous grass, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its clustered growth habit and yellowish-green foliage. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of grasses. Xyphostylis lutea is often found in moist, well-drained soils in open habitats such as grasslands and wetlands. Its botanical features make it an important component of the flora in its native ecosystems.
